content: elizabeth smith k n i t s mud season short-sleeved pullover pattern info stitch patterns mud season often used to describe the 5th season stockinette stitch st st in maine is a short-sleeved pullover knit seamlessly in the round knit all rounds from the top-down it makes an easy to knit & wear for a full list of techniques & abbreviations layering piece perfect for those in-between seasons used in this pattern see page 6 for tips & tutorials visit elizabethsmithknits com/mudseason-tips sizes xs s m l xl 2x 3x 4x 5x 6x finished bust circumference 33 36 5 38 5 42 45 25 48 5 51 75 54 58 5 63 / 84 93 98 107 115 123 131 137 149 160 cm picking your size choose a size that is approx 1-5 /3-13 cm larger than your actual bust measurement depending on your desired fit shown in size m being worn with approx 5 /13 cm of positive ease at the bust for all measurements see schematic on page 7 gauge 14 5 sts & 22 rnds = 4 /10 cm in st st in the round yarn approx 525 575 625 675 750 825 875 925 1025 1125 yds of bulky-weight yarn shown in ultra alpaca chunky by berroco 50% wool 50% alpaca 100g = 131 yds 5 5 5 6 6 7 7 8 8 9 skeins shown in color potting soil mix needles & other supplies construction mud season is knit all in one piece from the top- us 10/6 mm 24 /60 cm and 32 /80 cm circ or down and features raglan construction to shape the size needed to obtain gauge yoke for bottom ribbing us 9/5 5 mm 32 /80 cm circ piece begins at the neck and is worked back & or 1 needle size smaller than that used to obtain forth at first to shape the neckline and then is gauge joined to work in the round for sleeves us 10/6 mm dpns or size needed to sleeves are split at the underarm and body is obtain gauge or you can use 32 /80 cm circ if you worked in one piece to the hem with waist shaping are using magic loop although you can omit if you prefer for sleeve trim us 9/5 5 mm dpns or 1 needle sleeves are transferred to dpns or you can use size smaller than that used to obtain gauge or you 32 /80 cm circ for magic loop method and worked can use a 32 /80 cm circ if you are using magic in the round loop stitches are picked up along the neckline and worked in rib stitch to create neck trim for neck trim us 9/5 5 mm 16 /40 cm circ or 1 needle size smaller than that used to obtain gauge tips stitch markers in variety of colors for tips to help make your own mud season visit stitch holders or scrap yarn elizabethsmithknits com/mudseason-tips tapestry needle www
